author: jvanzyl
msg: Updating the generated build system to reflect some of the refactoring
I just did.

author: jvanzyl
msg: Adding executor beans, slowly moving away from the Ant coupling. Texen
is still a problem because I started with an Ant task for Maven instead
of using the bean pattern. But I will convert texen to a bean, I didn't
realize that Costin had the TaskAdapter cooked right into Ant to allow
beans to be used by Ant provided they contained a setProject() and execute()
method. Not sure why the setProject() is needed but it allows us to
have plain beans used by Ant which is what we want so that I can
use the beans in conjunction with a CLI util, or a GUI (more important for
the stuff I want to do).

author: jvanzyl
msg: A package that represents your basic bean that execute()'s something. The
executors are not fully decoupled from Ant as the base class provides some
ant features so that the TaskAdapter can be used but the subclasses are
just beans now and don't have any direct ant references apart from using
utilties like the directory scanner (which should probably go to the commons
as it is very useful).

author: jvanzyl
msg: Move the executor bean to the top-level package. Most of this code can
go go once the java parser is hooked in. A small visitor could easily
be made to replace the few elements of a java source file that the
code transformer actually uses to cross reference.

author: jvanzyl
msg: Moved to the top-level package, got rid of the required Touch
task which only sets the last modified time for a file in a manner
the works with 1.1. I don't care about java 1.1.
